description: Thee jalapeño is variously named in Mexico as huachinango and chile gordo. The cuaresmeño closely resembles the jalapeño. The seeds of a cuaresmeño have the heat of a jalapeño, but the flesh has a mild flavor close to a green bell pepper.

plant: Fruit color at maturity: green or red

food: Stuffed jalapeños are hollowed out fresh jalapeños (served cooked or raw) that are stuffed, often with a mix containing seafood, meat, poultry, and/or cheese.
Pickled jalapeños, sliced or whole, are often served hot or cold on top of nachos, which are tortilla chips with melted cheese on top, a traditional Tex-Mex dish
Jalapeño jelly can be prepared using jelling methods.
Jalapeño peppers are often muddled and served in mixed drinks.
other: Jalapeño juice is often used as a remedy for seasonal allergies and cardiovascular problems.

name: Jalapeño
